conclusion: To determine the turns ratio of the primary and secondary coils of the transformer.
Given: R1 = R2 = R3 = 50 Î©, Voltage reading across R3 is 10 V.
Since R2 and R3 are in series, the current through both resistors is the same: IR2 = IR3 = 0.2 A.
The voltage across R1 is the sum of the voltages across R2 and R3: VR1 = 20 V.
The current through R1 is: IR1 = 0.4 A.
The total current Is in the secondary coil is the sum of the currents through R1 and R2: Is = 0.6 A.
For an ideal transformer, the ratio of the currents in the primary and secondary coils is inversely proportional to the turns ratio.
Given: Primary current Ip = 1.4 A, Secondary current Is = 0.6 A.
Calculate the turns ratio: n1/n2 = Is/Ip = 3/7.
The turns ratio of the primary to secondary coils of the transformer is 3/7.
